intro: Axonopus chrysoblepharis, commonly known as the golden-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
